metadata.title: CVE-2022-37797 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In lighttpd 1.4.65, mod_wstunnel does not initialize a handler functionpointer if an invalid HTTP request (websocket handshake) is received. Itleads to null pointer dereference which crashes the server. It could beused by an external attacker to cause denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-gnutls - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-wolfssl - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-dbi - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-lua - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.67-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.67-1ubuntu2').
